intro: Manglietia fordiana, commonly known as the Chinese hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has broad, ovate leaves that are glossy and dark green, often with a waxy texture. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall. The flowers, which are typically pink or white, are followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds.
